intro: Eunanus kelloggii, commonly known as the Kellogg's eunanus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
